name: Programming Fundamentals
description: Essential programming concepts and terminology for beginners

cards.back: A named storage location that holds data which can be modified during program execution
The process of finding and fixing errors or bugs in code
A reusable block of code that performs a specific task and can accept inputs (parameters) and return outputs
A step-by-step procedure for solving a problem or completing a task

cards.front: What does 'syntax' refer to in programming?
cards.back: The set of rules that defines valid constructs in a programming language
A programming construct that repeats a block of code multiple times until a condition is met

cards.front: What is the difference between '==' and '=' in most programming languages?
cards.back: '=' assigns a value to a variable, while '==' compares two values for equality
A data structure that stores multiple values of the same type in a sequential collection
The process of translating source code written in a high-level language into machine code or bytecode
A system that tracks changes to files over time, allowing you to recall specific versions and collaborate with others
Integrated Development Environment - a software application that provides comprehensive tools for software development
The process of restructuring existing code without changing its external behavior to improve readability and maintainability
